sen.j: 地方三新法 （ちほうさんしんぽう）は、明治時代の日本が制定した三つの地方制度関連法のことである。
sen.e: Chiho San Shinpo (Three New Local Laws) refers to three laws on the Japanese local administration system that were enacted during the Meiji period.
Chiho San Shinpo (Three New Local Laws) refers to three laws on the Japanese local administration system that were enacted during the Meiji period.
Chiho San Shinpo (Three New Local Laws) refers to three laws on the Japanese local administration system that were enacted during the Meiji period.

sen.j: 三新法ともいう。
sen.e: They are also called Sanshinpo (Three New Laws).
They are also called Sanshinpo (Three New Laws).
They are also called Sanshinpo (Three New Laws).

sen.j: 具体的には郡区町村編制法、府県会規則、地方税規則の三つの法令をいう。
sen.e: More specifically, it refers to the following three laws: Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages), Fukenkai kisoku (the Rules for Prefectural Assemblies) and Chihozei kisoku (the Rules for Local Taxes).

More specifically, it refers to the following three laws: Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages), Fukenkai kisoku (the Rules for Prefectural Assemblies) and Chihozei kisoku (the Rules for Local Taxes).

More specifically, it refers to the following three laws: Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages), Fukenkai kisoku (the Rules for Prefectural Assemblies) and Chihozei kisoku (the Rules for Local Taxes).

sen.j: これにより明治時代において、全国統一の本格的な地方自治制度が確立した。
sen.e: A nationally-standardized system of local self-rule was established during the Meiji period through these laws.
A nationally-standardized local autonomy system was established during the Meiji period through these laws.
A nationally-standardized local autonomy system was established during the Meiji period through these laws.

sen.j: 三新法と関連重要諸法
sen.e: The Three New Laws and Other Important Laws Linked to Them
Three New Laws and Associated Important Laws
Three New Laws and Associated Important Laws

sen.j: 郡区町村編制法（明治11年太政官布告第17号）
sen.e: Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages, Dajokan Fukoku [Decree of the Grand Council of State] No.17 of 1878)
Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages, Dajokan Fukoku [Decree of the Grand Council of State] No. 17 of 1878)

sen.e: Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages, Dajokan Fukoku [Decree of the Grand Council of State] No. 17 of 1878)

Fukenkai kisoku (the Rules for Prefectural Assemblies, Dajokan Fukoku No. 18 of 1878)

sen.e: Chihozei kisoku (the Rules for Local Taxes, Dajokan Fukoku No. 19 of 1878)
Chihozei kisoku (the Rules for Local Taxes, Dajokan Fukoku No. 19 of 1878)
Chihozei kisoku (the Rules for Local Taxes, Dajokan Fukoku No. 19 of 1878)

sen.j: 府県官職制（明治11年太政官達第45号）
sen.e: Fukenkan shokusei (Personnel System of Prefectural Officials, Dajokan tasshi [proclamation by the Grand Council of State] No. 45 of 1878)
Fukenkan shokusei (Personnel System of Prefectural Officials, Dajokan tasshi [proclamation by the Grand Council of State] No. 45 of 1878)
Fukenkan shokusei (Personnel System of Prefectural Officials, Dajokan tasshi [proclamation by the Grand Council of State] No. 45 of 1878)

sen.j: 区町村会法（明治13年太政官布告第18号）
sen.e: Kuchosonkaiho (the Law Regarding Ward, Town and Village Assemblies, Dajokan Fukoku No. 18 of 1880)
Kuchosonkaiho (the Law Regarding Ward, Town and Village Assemblies, Dajokan Fukoku No. 18 of 1880)
Kuchosonkaiho (the Law Regarding Ward, Town and Village Assemblies, Dajokan Fukoku No. 18 of 1880)

sen.j: 各級の関係
sen.e: Relations among the Municipality Ranks
Relations among the Municipality Ranks
Relations among the Municipality Ranks

sen.j: 府（県と同格、重要地域の東京都、大阪府、京都府に府をおいた）
sen.e: Fu (Prefectures, equivalent to ken in rank, placed in important areas such as Tokyo, Osaka and Kyoto)
sen.cmt: 東京が府から都になったのは昭和に入ってからであること、prefectureが文中であまりにも重複することから、原文の「東京都、大阪府、京都府」はTokyo, Osaka and Kyotoとして訳しております。
sen.e: Fu (Prefectures, equivalent to ken in rank, established in important areas, such as Tokyo, Osaka and Kyoto)
Fu (Prefectures, equivalent to ken in rank, established in important areas, such as Tokyo, Osaka and Kyoto)

sen.j: 郡（旧来の郡を継承, 広いものは分割された）
sen.e: Gun (Counties, continuing former gun [districts], with bigger gun being divided up)
Gun (Counties,inheriting former gun [districts]; large gun were divided.)
Gun (Counties,inheriting former gun [districts]; large gun were divided.)

sen.j: 町（江戸時代からの町を継承)
sen.e: Cho (Towns, continuing the towns of the Edo period)
Cho (Towns, inheriting the towns of the Edo period)
Cho (Towns, inheriting the towns of the Edo period)

sen.j: 村（江戸時代からの村を継承)
sen.e: Son (Villages, continuing the villages of the Edo period)
Son (Villages, inheriting the villages of the Edo period)
Son (Villages, inheriting the villages of the Edo period)

sen.j: 区（都市においた,大都市は一つにまとめられず、複数の区に分割された）
sen.e: Ku (Wards, placed in cities, some cities being too large to be treated as a single unit and thus divided into several wards)
Ku (Wards, established in cities; some large cities are divided into several wards.)
Ku (Wards, established in cities; some large cities are divided into several wards.)

sen.e: Cho (Towns)

sen.j: 制定に至る経緯
sen.e: Details of the Legislation
Details of the Legislation
Details of the Legislation

sen.j: 地方三新法が制定された頃は、西南戦争は終結に至るも、農民一揆が頻発し、また自由民権運動が拡大しつつある社会状況であった。
sen.e: About the time when the Three Local New Laws were enacted, though the Seinan War had drawn to a close, peasants' uprisings were occurring frequently and the Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right) was growing.

When the Three Local New Laws were enacted, the Seinan War had drawn to its close, but peasants' uprisings were occurring frequently and the Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right) was growing.

When the Three Local New Laws were enacted, the Seinan War had drawn to its close, but peasants' uprisings were occurring frequently and the Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right) was growing.

sen.j: このような中で、政局を安定させるためにも地方制度改革が必要不可欠であるとの指摘がひろくなされた。
sen.e: In such circumstances, it was widely pointed out that reforming the local administrative system was indispensable in order to stabilize to political situation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In such circumstances, it was widely pointed out that reforming the local administrative system was indispensable in order to stabilize to political situation.
In such circumstances, it was widely pointed out that reforming the local administrative system was indispensable in order to stabilize to political situation.

sen.j: そのため、当時内務省 (日本)で内務卿を務め地方行政の整備に力を入れていた大久保利通により発案されたものである。
sen.e: Because of this, the laws above were proposed by Toshimichi OKUBO, who was serving as Minister of the Interior in the Ministry of the Interior (Japan) at the time and took a great interest in developing local administration.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because of this, the laws were proposed by Toshimichi OKUBO, who was serving as the Minister of the Interior in the Ministry of the Interior (Japan) at the time and took a great interest in developing local administration.

Because of this, the laws were proposed by Toshimichi OKUBO, who was serving as the Minister of the Interior in the Ministry of the Interior (Japan) at the time and took a great interest in developing local administration.

sen.j: 具体的には、明治11年（1878年）3月11日に大久保利通が三条実美太政大臣に提出した意見書「地方之体制等改正之儀」上申に基き、第2回地方官会議と元老院 (日本)の審議及び議決を経て制定された。
sen.e: To be concrete, they were drafted on the basis of the opinion paper 'in regard to the reorganization of the local administration system' which Toshimichi OKUBO submitted to the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) Sanetomi SANJO on March 11, 1878, and they were then adopted after the deliberations and resolutions of the second chihokan kaigi (assembly of prefectural governors) and the Genroin (the Chamber of Elders, Japan).

Specifically, they were drafted on the basis of an opinion paper titled 'reorganization of the local administration system' which Toshimichi OKUBO submitted to the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) Sanetomi SANJO on March 11, 1878, and they were then adopted after the deliberations and resolutions of the second chihokan kaigi (assembly of prefectural governors) and the Genroin (the Chamber of Elders, Japan).
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Specifically, they were drafted on the basis of an opinion paper titled 'reorganization of the local administration system' which Toshimichi OKUBO submitted to the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) Sanetomi SANJO on March 11, 1878, and they were then adopted after the deliberations and resolutions of the second chihokan kaigi (assembly of prefectural governors) and the Genroin (the Chamber of Elders, Japan).

sen.j: なお、草案起草は松田道之内務大書記官による。
sen.e: The draft was drawn up by the chief secretary of the Ministry of the Interior, Michiyuki MATSUDA.
The draft was drawn up by the chief secretary of the Ministry of the Interior, Michiyuki MATSUDA.
The draft was drawn up by the chief secretary of the Ministry of the Interior, Michiyuki MATSUDA.

sen.j: これに井上毅法制官が修正を加えている。
sen.e: Kowashi INOUE, an officer of the Legal Affairs Bureau, added some modifications to it.
Kowashi INOUE, an officer of the Legal Affairs Bureau, made some modifications to it.
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Kowashi INOUE, an officer of the Legal Affairs Bureau, made some modifications to it.

sen.j: 制度の概要
sen.e: The General Outline of the System
sen.cmt: 通常「概要」はSummaryとしていますが、ここでは制度自体の大枠の話をしているので、Outlineで訳出しました。
sen.e: Outline of the System
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を削除しました。
sen.e: Outline of the System

sen.j: 江戸時代からの自治の伝統があった町村には、自治の実態を認めつつ、戸長を通じて上からの決定を実施させることにした。
sen.e: While the central government permitted towns and villages which had had the tradition of self-government since the Edo period to preserve their existing autonomy, it made them carry out what it decided through kocho (the heads of towns and villages).

While the central government approved the autonomy of towns and villages which had had the tradition of self-government since the Edo period, it made them carry out decisions made through kocho (heads of towns and villages).
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: While the central government approved the autonomy of towns and villages which had had the tradition of self-government since the Edo period, it made them carry out decisions made through kocho (heads of towns and villages).

sen.j: 一つの町村に一人の戸長が原則だったが、実際にはすぐにいくつかの町村を包括する方式に移った。
sen.e: In principle, there was one kocho for each town and village, but in fact, it quickly came to be that one kocho covered several towns and villages.
In principle, there was one kocho for each town or village, but in fact, one kocho took charge of several towns or villages.
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: In principle, there was one kocho for each town or village, but in fact, one kocho took charge of several towns or villages.

sen.j: 町には町会、村には村会をおいた。
sen.e: Chokai (town assembly) were set up in towns and sonkai (village assembly) in villages
A chokai (town assembly) was set up in each town and a sonkai (village assembly) in each village.
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: A chokai (town assembly) was set up in each town and a sonkai (village assembly) in each village.

sen.j: 戸長は、これら町村会の意思を尊重して府県の知事が任命した。
sen.e: Kocho were appointed by prefectural governors, giving due respect to the opinions of these town and village assemblies.
Kocho were appointed by prefectural governors, giving due respect to the opinions of these town and village assemblies.
Kocho were appointed by prefectural governors, giving due respect to the opinions of these town and village assemblies.

sen.j: 府の長は府知事、県の長は県知事であった。
sen.e: The head of fu were the fuchiji (prefectural governors of fu), and the head of ken were the kenchiji (prefectural governors of ken).
The heads of fu were called fuchiji (prefectural governors of fu), and the heads of ken were called kenchiji (prefectural governors of ken).
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The heads of fu were called fuchiji (prefectural governors of fu), and the heads of ken were called kenchiji (prefectural governors of ken).

sen.j: 府には府会、県には県会をおいた。
sen.e: Fu and Ken had their own prefectural assemblies, Fukai and Kenkai.
Fu and Ken had their own prefectural assemblies, Fukai and Kenkai.
Fu and Ken had their own prefectural assemblies, Fukai and Kenkai.

sen.j: 府県会の議員は、財産ある男子の制限選挙により公選された。
sen.e: The member of prefectural assemblies were elected only by well-to-do men who were allowed to vote.
The members of prefectural assemblies were elected only by well-to-do men who were allowed to vote.
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The members of prefectural assemblies were elected only by well-to-do men who were allowed to vote.

sen.j: 府県会は府県の予算と税の徴収に関する議定の権限を持った。
sen.e: Prefectural assemblies had the power to confer and agree on their budgets and tax collection.
Prefectural assemblies had the power to confer and agree on their budgets and tax collection.
Prefectural assemblies had the power to confer and agree on their budgets and tax collection.

sen.j: 郡の長は郡長、区の長は区長であった。
sen.e: The heads of counties were guncho, and the heads of wards were kucho.
The heads of counties were called guncho, and the heads of wards were called kucho.
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The heads of counties were called guncho, and the heads of wards were called kucho.

sen.j: 郡会、区会はなかった。
sen.e: There were no county or ward assemblies.
There were no county or ward assemblies.
There were no county or ward assemblies.

sen.j: 近代地方自治のはじまり
sen.e: The Beginning of Modern Local Autonomy
Beginning of Modern Local Autonomy
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を削除しました。
sen.e: Beginning of Modern Local Autonomy

sen.j: 地方制度をすべて中央政府の延長にしようとした大区小区制の失敗に対する反省から、一定の地方自治を法定した。
sen.e: The government legislated a certain local autonomy after reconsidering the failure of the daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions), which had tried to make all local systems an extension of the central government.

The government legislated certain local autonomy after reconsidering the failure of the daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions), which was designed to make all local systems extensions of the central government.
sen.cmt: 文章表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The government legislated certain local autonomy after reconsidering the failure of the daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions), which was designed to make all local systems extensions of the central government.

sen.j: ただし、その譲歩は大きなものではなく、全体的にみれば集権的な地方制度であった。
sen.e: However, the concession was not a big one, and all things considered, it was still a centralized local administration system.
However, the concession was not great, and all things considered, it was still a centralized local administration system.
However, the concession was not great, and all things considered, it was still a centralized local administration system.

sen.j: 特に町村レベルには上からの法定以前に自治があったので、ここでの承認は自治拡大を意味するものではなかった。
sen.e: In particular, because the self-government at the level of towns and villages had already existed before being fixed by the central government, approval in this case did not mean greater autonomy for municipalities.

In particular, because the self-government at the level of towns and villages had already existed before being fixed by the central government, approval in this case did not mean greater autonomy for municipalities.

In particular, because the self-government at the level of towns and villages had already existed before being fixed by the central government, approval in this case did not mean greater autonomy for municipalities.

sen.j: むしろ、放任から干渉に転換して住民自治を削る試みの一環であった。
sen.e: Rather, it was a part of an attempt to switch from giving carte blanche to interference, and to reduce resident autonomy.
Rather, it was a part of an attempt to change from noninterference to interference and to reduce resident autonomy.
Rather, it was a part of an attempt to change from noninterference to interference and to reduce resident autonomy.

sen.j: もっとも、府県会設置は、地方自治と議会制に向けた実質的前進であった。
sen.e: Although setting up prefectural assemblies was substantial progress towards local autonomy and the parliamentary system.
Setting up prefectural assemblies was substantial progress towards local autonomy and the parliamentary system.
sen.cmt: 余分と思われる単語を削除しました。
sen.e: Setting up prefectural assemblies was substantial progress towards local autonomy and the parliamentary system.

sen.j: 様々な制限があったとしても、各地の府県会が自由民権運動派の政府攻撃の拠点となったことは、府県会自治が空虚な器でなかったことを意味している。
sen.e: Even though there were various limitations, the fact that the prefectural assemblies all over the country became the bases for the Jiyu Minken Undo sects to criticize and attack the government shows that the autonomy of prefectural assemblies was not a hollow gesture.

Even though there were various limitations, the fact that the prefectural assemblies all over the country became the bases for the Jiyu Minken Undo sects to criticize and attack the government means that the autonomy of prefectural assemblies was not a hollow gesture.

Even though there were various limitations, the fact that the prefectural assemblies all over the country became the bases for the Jiyu Minken Undo sects to criticize and attack the government means that the autonomy of prefectural assemblies was not a hollow gesture.
